column5: Corrected final results put Tony and Paul in 9th place, 5.06 pounds off the winners.
They had a stressed fish penalty or they would have placed 5th
I find Ice works great on Stress summer time Walleyes? Great show Tony.
Thanx bandit

I'm on Douglas Lake, west of Red Lake and the water was up 3 feet. It's gone down 20 inches in the last week and a half. Still the dock is destroyed.....needed a new one some day...... guess it is now. Strange that with such high water, the fishing has been great!! I mean lots of hungry large and small fish....just in different places. We are seeing more small walleye than usual... good sign for lake health. They were of course at the mouth of the fast flowing creeks but also on the points and narrows of the lake. A small northern took up residence in the flooded gas shed. A beaver knawed through the phone line. finally out of rubber boots.....
Elizabeth, it's always good to hear from you.Thanks for your posts.
Fishing a Walleye Tournament VS information for a once a year family fishing trip?
Due to the economic times i must prefish on the internet as i cant afford to put gas in my 250 VRod
Let me know when u wake up lol
i have a spot on Red lake by the red marker ,last week i caught 2- 28ins and 1- 29 in i think they will be there during the tourny pm me i will give you directions
Im lookin for 30 inchers sorry lol
I still love you Tony but some of us work for a living?
what does that mean becuz im sure i put more work hours in a week than u do lol hmmmm, sounds like your a bit jealous
Hey guys, Tony Shirley and his partner are leading the pack after the first day with 14.34 pounds.
awesome go TONY
Tony Shirley and Paul Marion finished 33rd in a field of 139. 4.98 pounds behind the winning team.
Hows the fishin in red lake i heard the water is very high
Peoples mouths in red lake are tighter than a walleye after a cold front lol

Hey Tony, do you suppose they might be out on the water since fishing has been going well and they're having nice weather this week. I'll be up there either for 9 days in mid September or two weeks in early October. There may be only two people in our camp and we might be the only ones in the neighborhood out on the water. Would like to have another boat fired up so we can be sure to get back in at night. Without being up there right now I can still tell you that fishing is better than good. I believe the Red Lake Tournament is being held next weekend. Check the results. PM me for the site.

hey, 3 days befor the tournament, nobody wants to share. but i'll tell you this, I tried red lake yesterday and I was by potato island and probably 25 boats went passed me and headed to pipestone bay. what does that tell you?got a number of little fish (10 -15) inches and a few that were 22 inches but nothing over the magic number of 23 inches.I tried several spots in different areas of the lake with the same results.the web site is redlakefallclassic.com
Flying up there tomorrow (Tuesday) to ride along with a team that is pre-fishing for the tournament. Water has to still be high. Check out the CKDR website for Red Lake high water pictures.
Hey Steve, take your GPS along and mark some good spots. Maybe buzz my friend Brett on Little Vermilion. Camp is just north of the Middle Narrows. Watch out for flack.
Tackleman, are you entered in the tournament? If so, good luck.
Tony your Internet Prefishing?
I like that concept...........Pre-fishing. Isn't that what this forum is about??? I wish I was pre-fishing Gull Rock. rats.

Golden Eagle, I think you are on to me. My job is to fly around and mark spots on the GPS when I see someone catching a fish. No, not really, but I did have to sign a document in blood about not sharing spots, or my jigs would be taken away for a year.
